page.title: 01Glen Ling
page.content: This area is divided in two by the river Ling. On the east bank is Ben Killilan, Killilan Estate and on the west side is mainly Attadale Estate except a small area of conifer in the north west owned by the forestry commission. the ground cover is mainly heather, and rough grazing with boggy areas. the river is fished for salmon. Red and roe deer and foxes roam wild. sheep and some highland cattle are farmed. At the southern end of the glen stands the shepherd/keeper's house and outbuildings at Nonach.
